title: Why banning doesn't work, Prisoner Island does, and Riot has no idea what they're doing

replies.body:
That is all just your opinion on the matter.

The reason for perm bans is to have a price for getting in trouble because no one wants to lose something they invested time and potentially money into. By making an Island, which comes with its own slew of problems, you also start saying "Hey! Be as toxic and volatile as you want! No bans!" Which begins to actually push more people away, but I'll address my grievances with the Prisoner Island next.

Issues I have with the idea (yes, my opinion):

1. As stated, it will push away more people than bans do. Remember, the number of people punished is actually a minority. "But they'll end up at PI." After how long though? How much damage will they cause first?

2. Cost; unless you are limiting the game mode for the Prisoner Island, then Riot will have to make game servers for each of the game modes and maps. "They aren't a small idie company and can afford it." Yes, but for how long? A game needs to be profitable or even at worse. When it starts to cost more to maintian servers than what you make, games start shutting down.

3. In and Out; When do you go into PI? First offense? At Perm? After both chat restricts? Are you including gameplay bans? Depending on how you answer these, the situation is worse for people who may only make the mistake once. You mentioned having a hidden Honor way out too. What happens when people don't honor anyone? What if they are only honoring the person who carried? What if they honor the biggest troll/flamer in the match? You start running the risk of the wrong people getting out.


Now, you want to claim that blinds and the NPE is "Prisoner's Island" and again I will mention that is your opinion. I don't have much issues in blinds with toxicity of any kind (gameplay or verbal) and when I made new accounts, it was fairly obvious I was playing with other smurfs. Yes, probably by level 5 you are going to mainly be playing against other people of similar mmr (smurfs) anf again, don't seem to have any issies with toxicity.

Question 1
How invested are you in a game where within five levels you have enough BE to get any champ available (over 13K if you choose to disenchant every shard you get) There is no investment in a game where nothing actually costs anything besides cosmetics.

Question 2
Who are toxic people hurting by being toxic to other toxic people? You assume that I'm changing the way the automated system works. It would take as long as it does presently and nothing would change on your end of the spectrum. My argument is to give reform a chance instead of continuing a vicious cycle of petty spiteful account making.

Question 3
Yes they should be locked to a game mode called Prisoner Island (Lord knows they have space since dominion RIP) and riot is profitable don't act like riot doesn't make hand over fist. Riot doesn't get to be one of the biggest game companies in the world and the poor man, it doesn't work both ways.

Question 4
How would you determine when prisoner island is tennible, obviously you could use shock tactics and have scaling requirements for release but you propose gaming the system. Thing is you can't stop bad people from doing bad things, however you should never prevent good people from doing good things to prevent bad people from doing bad things. Yes the system can be cheesed however they will just throw themselves back in because they didn't EARN their way out, conversely, anyone who does will have reformed honestly and truly. 

You see the game for what you see it as, of course my opinion is all I can present, but to discard a 'small minority' is actually a very ignorant thing to do because that minority is still in your games, being toxic, ruining them,  and even if YOU don't personally experience (Which being totally honest is a very selfish and close-minded point of view to be expressed, so long as you aren't bothered then it's fine) Others are. Toxicity is the number one criticism of any new player to league.

Answer 1
Time is still an investment itself, hence why I said "time and potentially money". I realize not everyone spends money on the game, but you still spend time.

Answer 2
You misread what I actually put or maybe what I meant was clear enough. As of right now, people don't want to lose an account and are more likely to at least pretend to behave. With your system it is a matter of just being placed with similar people eventually. Since you won't lose your account, what is the point in behaving?
Additionally, let us take a look at our EUW friend, Gumbas.
>People just don't understand there are toxic players who are toxic for the sake of being toxic and there are the "toxic" players who are sick of recieving shit but not giving any

So do I believe Gumbas is a toxic individual? Not at all. But based on his closing statement, I truly believe he would have issues leaving PI because of lashing out against toxic people.

Answer 3
So you are restricting them to a singular mode and map. I still believe the "cycle" would continue with this then. People would want to return to their modes of choice and realize it is easier to just create a new account. Now they are still upset at Riot for locking their account in a place they can't leave. 
Yes, Riot currently makes profit and could immediately maintain those servers. But how long could they keep them? Same argument presented when people want Riot to hire 1k people to perform manual reviews for "trolls". They can, but eventually the cost outweighs the benefits.

Answer 4
I don't propose how to game the system. These are legitimate questions that you need to answer for your idea. 
When does someone fall into the PI system? This is an actually important question.

 I imagine you are familiar with GTAV. And how they essentially use PI. I got sent there for blowing up other players cars because they either kept trying to run me over or had a bounty on them. I quit playing after that because I was placed in a PI for false reasons.

Which is why again you need to answer "When does someone actually fall into the PI system?".  Too early and many people will quit, especially without clear cut way to get out. Too late and damage is already done.


If you want to call me close minded, then you need to accept that you are as well. I understand that toxicity is a problem. You want to claim that the moment you get a chat restriction, you are set to be permanently banned. Old data we have been given states otherwisre. Anecedotal evidence of players will show otherwise too. I got pinged by the system once, and then never got pinged again. You speak as if people permed are guaranteed to make a new account and ruin more games.

> So do I believe Gumbas is a toxic individual? Not at all. But based on his closing statement, I truly believe he would have issues leaving PI because of lashing out against toxic people.

Aye, If i'll get a chance to enter PI and get my account back, I'm gonna literally suck dick all day long until deemed reformed.

That is fine, but here is a counter idea.

Since you want to create a gameplay server why not just go for a Toxic Queue? A queue you can go in voluntarily and tbe report function simply doesn't work in it.
Sure it has downsides too, but it is something. Then the punishment system can remain the same.

I'm all for this idea as well as a stress relief but it would be kind of impossible to uphold standards of internet practices with such a mode. But some kind of vent would be healthy for the league populice I fully support Sewer Que

Nope, I'd rather they just keep banning toxic players.  They should also be far more strict against toxicity at the early levels and have MMR adjust more aggressively to separate smurfs from real new players more quickly.

Problem is, banning a toxic player doesn't get rid of them, unless you're only selfishly thinking of your own rank tier. In which yes Banning does work for single solo q rank but they eventually show up again and again and again and my solution was more a grand scheme of things solution.

Correction: It doesn't get rid of _all_ of them.  A good number of permanently banned players leave the game.  Some make smurfs, but a lot of them just leave.  I know if I ever failed to meet the super low behavior threshold of not being an asshole and lost my account over it, I'd probably leave.  

And like I said, in combination with permanent bans, MMR should move more quickly at low levels to separate smurfs from real new players, and the threshold for getting penalized at low levels should be much less forgiving, to quickly ban out toxic players again.

I also wouldn't be opposed to Riot using something other than email address for verification.  Perhaps require a non-internet phone number.  That would create an additional barrier to smurf creation.

Again, you're framing all your arguments from a personal lense and making strawman arguments demonizing people who have been judged toxic. There's no evidence that people actually quit the game once they get banned, in fact, there's more evidence that the opposite is true and almost nobody stays away once they get banned.  I'd love to see your statistics stating that Perma banned players leave in any number. Also the threshold isn't low for toxic behavior actually it's pretty high to not be toxic. You have two choices either be false positive 100% of the time or stay utterly absolutely silent. Any criticism perceived or otherwise can net you a chat restriction and from there it just goes downhill until you adopt one of the two aforementioned attitudes

That's why /mute all exists and why a lot of games have no interaction between the enemy teams.

The evidence is that Riot says when they permanently ban people, most of them don't come back.  Yes, you see some people coming back.  That doesn't mean that everyone comes back, or even that most comes back.  What would the proof be of someone not coming back?  You don't see them around?  Guess what, you don't see them around.

And I am not demonizing anyone.  Riot has stated that the VAST MAJORITY of players never get so much as a warning.  And then of those that do, the VAST MAJORITY never get a second one because they reform.  It is a TINY fraction of the player base that absolutely refuses to meet the minimum behavioral requirements, the absolute most basic levels of human decency which end up permanently banned.

There was a comment earlier of the "pedestal paradox."  The idea behind the comment was that the few non-toxic players are standing on a pedestal while the masses swarm underneath.  But that's not the case.  It is the vast majority of players playing on common ground while the toxic players are swimming around in the sewers.

Edit: And by the way, I offer criticism once in a while. I have never been penalized. In fact, I did so just last game. Granted, it was ARAM, but our Veigar wandered over to them and got picked off before our team was even close. My criticism, "We need to stop getting picked off. Let's stick together." My criticism was not, "Fucking Veigar stop feeding." It isn't criticism that gets penalized, it's harassment. You can provide criticism without being an asshole.

The paradox warns that people who elevate themselves above others by virtue of deed or birth are neither deserving or any better than those they scorn.

And you keep going back to _deserving_ a chance.  but why?

You make an interesting comparison there with slaves.  Slaves were kidnapped from their villages and brought over unwillingly.  They were oppressed from the start.  This is not the same for toxic players.  They didn't start off at the bottom, they started off on the "pedestal" with the rest of us.  Their own choices, their own behavior were the cause of their situation.  They're the ones who inflicted upon the "normal" players their vitriol.  And even then, they were given chance after chance, warning after warning to reform, and they chose not to, even to the point of being permanently banned.

And by the way, these players that you are trying to defend, that you are saying deserve pity, mercy, and a second chance, they are the same players you are saying will create smurfs and intentionally ruin the experience of new players.  So which is it?  Are they on the path to reformation or are they permanently toxic even on a new account?  That's why they don't deserve another chance.  They should lose their accounts, and if they truly want to reform and continue being part of the community, they should create new accounts and do things right.
